IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FOUR-YEAR ACCREDITED ART ACADEMY COLLEGE, OFFERING BFAS AND ONE MA PROGRAM. MISSION IS TO CREATE AND SUSTAIN RADICAL FORWARD-THINKING, CONTEMPORARY VISUAL ARTISTS AND DESIGNERS WHOSE CREATIVE CONTRIBUTIONS MAKE A SUBSTANTIAL DIFFERENCE IN ALL THE LIVES THEY TOUCH.
IRS990.MissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO OPERATE, MAINTAIN, AND OVERSEE AN INDEPENDENT COLLEGE OF ART AND DESIGN.
IRS990.Desc: WE OPERATE AN ACCREDITED POST-SECONDARY FINE ARTS EDUCATION FACILITY (ART ACADEMY) OFFERING CURRICULUM LEADING TO A BACHELOR OF FINE ARTS DEGREE, AND A MASTERS IN ART EDUCATION. WE SERVE APPROXIMATELY 240 MATRICULATING STUDENTS. IN ADDITION, WE SERVE APPROXIMATELY 300 INDIVIDUALS IN OUR COMMUNITY ARTS EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ACADEMY'S COLLECTIONS ARE MADE UP OF ART OBJECTS THAT ARE HELD FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION, EDUCATION AND RESEARCH FOR FURTHERANCE OF PUBLIC SERVICE. THE COLLECTIONS, WHICH WERE ACQUIRED THROUGH PURCHASES AND CONTRIBUTIONS SINCE THE ACADEMY'S INCEPTION, ARE NOT RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS ON THE CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE ITEMS ARE ACQUIRED. CONTRIBUTED COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT REFLECTED ON THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PROCEEDS FROM SALES OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE REFLECTED AS INCREASES IN TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS. EACH OF THE ITEMS IS CATALOGED, PRESERVED AND CARED FOR, AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED CONTINUOUSLY. THE COLLECTIONS ARE SUBJECT TO A POLICY THAT REQUIRES PROCEEDS FROM THEIR SALES TO BE USED TO ACQUIRE OTHER ITEMS FOR COLLECTIONS. DURING BOTH THE YEARS ENDED MAY 31, 2022 AND 2021, SALES OF ART TOTALED $-0-. DURING BOTH THE YEARS ENDED MAY 31, 2022 AND 2021, THERE WERE NO ITEMS IN THE ACADEMY'S COLLECTIONS THAT WERE DAMAGED OR DESTROYED.
THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO SUPPORT THE ACADEMY'S VARIOUS PURPOSES.

THE ART ACADEMY OF CINCINNATI AND ART ACADEMY HOUSING, INC. ARE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND ARE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ACADEMY HAS ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENT RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. THE ACADEMY RECOGNIZED NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES IN THE CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF ACTIVITIES FOR EITHER OF THE YEARS ENDED MAY 31, 2023 OR 2022. IF THE SITUATION AROSE IN WHICH THE ACADEMY WOULD HAVE INTEREST TO RECOGNIZE, IT WOULD RECOGNIZE THIS AS INTEREST EXPENSE AND PENALTIES WOULD BE RECOGNIZED IN OTHER EXPENSES. CURRENTLY, THE PRIOR THREE YEARS ARE OPEN UNDER FEDERAL AND STATE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS AND REMAIN SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND CHANGE. THE ACADEMY IS NOT CURRENTLY UNDER AUDIT, NOR HAS THE ACADEMY BEEN CONTACTED BY THESE JURISDICTIONS. BASED ON THE EVALUATION OF THE ACADEMY'S TAX POSITIONS, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES ALL POSITIONS TAKEN WOULD BE UPHELD UNDER AN EXAMINATION. THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR THE EFFECTS OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAS BEEN RECORDED FOR EITHER OF THE YEARS ENDED MAY 31, 2023 OR 2022.
THE ART ACADEMY OF CINCINNATI PUBLISHES ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY ON THEIR WEBSITE, NEWSLETTERS AND SOCIAL MEDIA
THE ART ACADEMY OF CINCINNATI RECEIVES STATE AND CITY GRANTS FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS, FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, INTERNALLY FUNDED THROUGH OPERATIONS & ENDOWMENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE REGISTRAR AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR GPA REQUIREMENTS, ENROLLMENT REQUIREMENTS, AND OTHER ISSUES. REVIEWS ARE DONE REGULARLY.
THE SUBSIDIARY THAT PROVIDED STUDENT HOUSING WAS LIQUIDATED ON 5/16/2023 AND NOW THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAINTAIN AND OPERATE THE STUDENT HOUSING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTE WILL REVIEW THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING, AND THEN IF APPROVED, THE FORM 990 WILL BE SENT TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS DISTRIBUTED TO ALL NEW TRUSTEES, OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES. THE POLICY CLEARLY EXPLAINS THE DUTY TO REPORT ANY SUSPECTED VIOLATIONS AND THE PROCEDURES TO FOLLOW. THE ANNUAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE STATEMENT IS TO BE SIGNED AND RETURNED TO THE FINANCE OFFICE. THE ORGANIZATON PERIODICALLY REVIEWS THE ANNUAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE STATEMENT. IF A CONFLICT IS DISCOVERED, THE TRUSTEE WITH A CONFLICT CANNOT VOTE ON THE ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO/PRESIDENT COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR INDIVIDUAL(S) AUTHORIZED BY THE BOARD. DATA ON COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS ALONG WITH PERFORMANCE REVIEWS ARE USED TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIALS ARE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE ART ACADEMY'S WEBSITE AT WWW.ARTACADEMY.EDU. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIALS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN REMAINDER TRUST -5,339. CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN PERPETUAL TRUST -15,432. LIQUIDATING DISTRIBUTION FROM A SECTION 501(C)(3) 165,818.
THE OVERSIGHT PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
